Job Posting:171509 - Position: F25 Fullstack Software Developer Co-Op Student 171509 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 08/01/2025 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 07/22/2025 11:48 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Tetra Tech Suite 1000 10th Floor 885 Dunsmuir Street Vancouver V6C 1N5 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 Fullstack Software Developer Co-Op Student 171509 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 8 or 12 months In-Person CAD 25.0 per hour for 40 Major List Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world's most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists. Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®. At Tetra Tech we recognize that it is essential to actively and consistently recruit new talent who bring fresh perspectives and diverse skills to our team. Our reputation is built on our ability to find innovative solutions to complex quality-of-life issues around the globe. We pride ourselves on our forward-thinking, progressive-minded attitude. Our technical professionals strive for the highest level of excellence. Tetra Tech FusionMap (https://www.FusionMap.com) is currently seeking to recruit up to 2 Co-Op students for the 2025 work term. The work will be located at or downtown Vancouver office and will involve supporting the continuous development of SaaS platforms, integration of AI in B2B platforms, and Geospatial Analytics. Role: • Fullstack Software Developer Co-Op. Work term to be either 8 or 12 months. Responsibilities: • Development of new frontend and backend features including testing and documentation. • Knowledge of RESTful API design and integration. • Cloud data management using Azure platform. • Familiarity with agile development practices and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. • Understanding of web security principles and ability to implement security and data protection measures. • Quickly learn and adapt new methodologies for our applications. • Assist with development and implementation of the state-of-the-art Machine Learning models from roadway, railway and other complex environment. Communicate effectively with team members using established procedures. • About Tetra Tech: Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 550 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees-30,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities: LinkedIn: @TetraTechCareers Twitter: @TetraTechJobs Job Requirements Qualifications: • Willingness and ability to learn and work in agile environment. • Knowledge of programming in Typescript, Python, Node JS, React, Express, Swift • You must have a strong understanding of RDBMS, including Postgres SQL. • Knowledge of Dockerization and Microservices is an asset. • Knowledge of Azure Cloud is an asset. • Knowledge of iOS app development is an asset. • Ability to take ownership of problems and deliver results • Ability to learn independently, think fast, and use solid judgement • Possess strong critical and creative problem-solving skills complemented by excellent attention to detail • Have excellent communication skills - both verbal and written are required to effectively collaborate with team members, discuss ideas, provide feedback, and share knowledge Additional Information: A requirement of working for Tetra Tech is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. (A copy of a valid work permit may be required.) Citizenship Requirement N/A Position Start Date September 02, 2025 12:00 AM APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Cover Letter Required?
